title.narrative: NATIONAL SYSTEMS

description.narrative: Strengthened national and sub-national M&E systems, mechanisms and capacity of line ministries for evidence-based and equity focused policymaking and reforms, which contributes to Child Poverty / Public Finance For Children, Children In Urban Settings / Local Governance, Corporate External Relations And Partnerships, Communication And Resource Mobilization, Cross-Sectoral Monitoring, Data And Situation Analyses, Cross-Sectoral Planning And Programme Reviews, Other Cross-Sectoral Programme Areas, Public Finance And Local Governance, Social Exclusion â€“ Data And Evidence, Social Protection, Social Protection And Child Poverty, Technical Excellence In Policy And Programmes. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Evaluations, Research And Data, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Strengthened national and sub-national government policies and strategies, based on quality, child sensitive evidence and budget analysis, to respond to the needs of vulnerable population groups, especially women and children

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Strengthened national and sub-national M&E systems, mechanisms and capacity of line ministries for evidence-based and equityfocused policymaking and reforms
of national databases and reports with disaggregated data

baseline.value: 5 out of 6 databases and reports with disaggregated data by sex, geographic, wealth

target.value: 2015:6 out of 6 databases and reports with disaggregated data by sex, geographic, wealth

actual.value: 2015:5/6 databases and reports with disaggregated data by sex, geographic, wealth etc. CamInfo (by MoP/NIS), EMIS (by MoEYS), HIS (by MoH), CDB (by MoP/NCDDS), WASH database (by MRD), Social protection database (by CARD is under development) provide disaggregated data.

title.narrative: Risk and vulnerability analysis incorporated into situation analyses of children or other related processes, with UNICEF support

baseline.value: NSDP, sub-national plans and situation analysis not explicitly incorporated situation of children and indicators to monitor them

target.value: 2015:All SitAn, national surveys and development plans supported by UNICEF incorporated risks and vulnerability of children

actual.value: 2015:Yes. Birth registration and child poverty indicators included in NSDP. MOP agreed for the inclusion of child poverty measurement into national poverty (monetary measurement). ECD module included in CDHS of 2014, on-going support is provided to selected provincial situation analysis to inform invest

title.narrative: Social protection mechanisms that track disaggregated beneficiaries by sex and age, with UNICEF support

target.value: 2015:M&E system developed to monitor and track progress of social protection intervention

actual.value: 2015:M&E system is under development by CARD.
